Ahmed's Situation:
	•	Bilal's friend in Syria since 2016, has one child with second baby coming
	•	Needs $1,200 for wife's C-section travel and hospital costs
Bilal's Plan:
	•	Will front the $1,200 initially but needs fundraising help
	•	Long-term goal: buy Ahmed a truck for produce transportation business (farmer → self-sufficiency)
Problem:
	•	Two fundraising campaigns cancelled (Syrian recipient, then French recipient)
	•	Frustrated despite believing Syria sanctions are lifted
Request:
	•	Wants Chris to explain campaign cancellations
	•	Seeking long-term fundraising solution for Syria
	•	Will connect Chris with Pal-Lend and Madad Fund

Here’s a conversational short version you could send, in your own voice:  

---

Hey Chris, thanks for getting back to me. So here’s the situation: Ahmed’s been my friend since 2016, back when we lived together in Lebanon. He’s now back in Syria, has one child, and his wife is about to deliver their second baby. She needs a C-section, which will cost about $1,200 including hospital and travel.  

I told him I’d front the money, but honestly I can’t really afford it, so I wanted to give people the chance to chip in. Longer term, I’d love to help him buy a truck so he can start a produce transport business—he’s a farmer at heart and it would make him self-sufficient.  

The problem is, I tried to set up campaigns—first with him in Syria as the recipient, then with me in France—and both got cancelled. I thought sanctions had eased since I’ve seen other Syria campaigns, so I don’t understand why mine didn’t go through.  

I also wanted to connect you with Pal-Lend and Madad Fund, since I think the bigger question is how to make long-term support into Syria possible. Curious to hear your thoughts.  

---  

Do you want me to make it even shorter and more informal, like something you’d say in a WhatsApp chat?
